content: let s start a riot blanket gwen kok the woolly closet stitchgwen this blanket is great for beginner and experienced crocheters who want to go just a little bit further than an average granny stripe this blanket is an excellent scrap yarn or stash buster tie all your leftover together with a magic knot and make a big ball you can then either crochet from the ball or cake them up like i do with my yarn winder and have center pull cakes here s a link for a magic knot tutorial by bella coco you can use to tie all your yarn together this way you will not have to sew in all those ends https //www youtube com/watch v=15hqor0kjha this pattern is written in us terms abbrevations chain chain single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet treble_crochet skip skip st stitch beg double_crochet first st of a row single_crochet in first st and make a chain this equals a double_crochet stitch note the treble_crochet in the pattern after the set-up row is done around the ch1 of the row underneath and into the st two row down not in front of the ch1 the pattern set-up row 1 chain a multiple of 4 stitches + 3 for a decent sized blanket chain 220 + 3 turn in the fourth chain from the hook make a double_crochet double_crochet across turn set-up row 2 in first st make a beg double_crochet double_crochet in next st next make treble_crochet between the double_crochet s of the row underneath the st you re supposed to crochet in you can see that longer stitch in pink in the photo underneath 1 double_crochet in next st chain 1 skip 1 repeat these stitches until last 4 st 1 double_crochet in next st 1 treble_crochet in next st like before 1 double_crochet in nest st 1dc in last st the last stitch might be difficult to see it s the single_crochet ch1 you make the last double_crochet of your row in the ch1 turn row 3 beg double_crochet 1dc in next st chain 1 skip 1 *1dc in next st 1tr in skipped st 2 row down 1dc in next st ch1 skip 1 st * repeat ** until last 2 stitches double_crochet in each of those st turn row 4 beg double_crochet 1dc in next st 1tr in skipped st 2 row down 1dc in next st *ch1 sk1 1dc in next st 1tr in skipped st 2 row down 1dc in next st * repeat ** until 1 st left double_crochet in last st turn row 3 row 4 repeat row 3 & 4 until you ve reached your desired blanket length final row 1dc in each st 1 treble_crochet in each skipped st until end of row you re now ready to make a border around your blanket of your choosing i made a simple single_crochet round in black around mine as the blanket was
